PITT OHIO Web Services (API)

PITT OHIO Web Services provide XML feeds directly to your website or any of your internal systems. PITT OHIO Web Services currently provide access to: Rate Quotes, Pickup, BOL, Shipment Tracing, Transit Times and Images. Please contact APIsupport@pittohio.com with any questions regarding our web services or to get started.
If you would like to receive email notifications on technical changes that would affect your web services, please send your email address to APIsupport@pittohio.com.

Gateway
Incorporate a link to the PITT OHIO website within your company's website. Output from this gateway includes an initial display of the latest shipment status for all shipments traced, with links to drill down to complete details. The B2B gateway may be accessed by using pro numbers or by using your own bill of lading numbers. This gateway is suitable for insertion into a frame or table cell.

Gokwik integrates with your website and supports your customers to place orders via Cash on Delivery and UPI options. The following document has essential features for integrating your website with Gokwik. The steps are:Step 1: Predict API (Risk Intelligence)Reference: https://cdn.gokwik.co/rto-doc/rto-predict-api.pdf   Step 2: Create order from the backendSandbox Endpoint: https://sandbox.gokwik.co/v1/order/create

})Step 4: Payment Notification CallbackPayment Notification webhook:
This webhook would be provided by the merchant which will be used to notify any of the payments against the order. This will mark order paid at merchant backend. the data which we will send on this webhook is as below.




Note: Call Payment Verify API to Manually verify Payment.

}Step 5: Update OrderOutside web-flow
This endpoint would be used to relay all the order-related status updates mentioned below.




Sample Order Statuses:


pending = order has been created and it usually before payment


processing = order has been moved to processing status usually post payment confirmation


shipped = order has been shipped or dispatched from the warehouse


in-transit = order is on the way to the customer


delayed = order has been delayed by expected ETA


rto = order returned to origin


ofd = out for delivery


cancelled = order got cancelled by either admin or user


returned = order has been returned from user not RTO


delivered = order has been delivered to end user







Endpoint: https://sandbox.gokwik.co/v1/order/update

columnsModelsData Library Report ModelReport ModelAPI docs by RedoclyEntities Reports API (1.0.1)Download OpenAPI specification:DownloadIntroductionThe Entities Reports API is the developer interface for Diligent Entities that you can use to integrate Diligent Entities with other systems in your company. You can retrieve the following reports data available in Diligent Entities:

Companies
Data Libraries
Appointments
Individuals
Partnerships
Other Entities
Committees
Shared Addresses
Shared Contacts
Pending Events
Shareholders

The Entities Reports REST API uses standard HTTPS requests to access data and returns responses in JSON format. 
For each available report, you can make three types of requests depending on the data you want to retrieve:

You can retrieve the report with all available data.
You can retrieve the report with the data you specify.
You can retrieve the list of available data for the report.

Postman CollectionA Postman Collection is available for the Entities Reports API which enables you to jump-start working with the API. The collection contains example requests for each available endpoint.  The current Entities Reports API Postman collection is available to fork or copy from the link below.

Getting StartedTo start interacting with the Entities Reports API, you need to complete the following:

Set up access to Entities Reports API
Authenticate to Entities Reports API

LicensingThe Entities Reports API is available to clients with a professional or enterprise package. For more information, contact your Customer Success Manager (CSM).
1. Set up access to Entities Reports APIBefore you start interacting with the Reports API, you must complete the following steps required for access:  

Request site configuration for API calls
Create a user for API access
Create the access token

For detailed instructions, go to "Entities Reports API" in Entities Help Center.
1.1 Request site configuration for API calls
Each Entities site you want to make API calls to requires internal network configuration. Site configuration can take between 5 and 10 business days. 
To request API configuration for your sites, contact your Customer Success Manager and provide the web address of each site you want to configure for API calls, including test sites.
Download API values
After the sites are configured, you receive an email with a link to files containing API configuration values. For each configured site, you receive a separate API values document. 

Select View Content in the email to access the file shared with you.
In Secure File Sharing, select Download from the document menu to save the Entities API Values document to your computer.

The table below shows example values for the request URL and the API key: 



Variable Name
Value



request_URL
https://us.api.diligentcloudservices.com/entities


X-Api-Key
FXo06wgzIY8OBGxrUYmh3KZtdWRUetY33Q1NN4Ch


1.2 Create a user for API access
This section contains an overview of the steps you need to complete to create an API user. 
For detailed instructions, go to "Entities Reports API" in Entities Help Centre.

In Entities, create a new user role for API access. Use the role to configure the permissions needed for accessing the Reports API. 
You may need to adjust the user role rights or permissions. To find out which permissions are needed, send a Get metadata request to each endpoint you want to retrieve data from. The requiredAccessRight field in the response contains the information about the user permissions. 

Create a user with the new user role.


1.3 Create the API access token
An access token is a string that identifies a user and authenticates access to the Entities Reports API. 
Use the new user credentials to log in to Entities and create the access token. Access tokens can be set to expire within between 1 and 365 days. 
For detailed instructions, go to "Entities Reports API" in Entities Help Centre.
2. Authenticate to Entities Reports APIAll requests require authentication. The Entities Reports API uses the OAuth 2.0 authentication protocol. 

In the Postman collection, select Variables. 
Add the API values from the API values document you received. 
Find the access_Token variable and add the token you created in Entities as its value. 
Save your changes.

You can now make calls to Entities Reports API.  # Sending Requests
Once you have completed the authentication process, you can start sending requests.
Unique IdentifiersWhen you create a record in Diligent Entities, a quick reference is assigned to it. This quick reference is unique throughout the lifecycle of the entity. You can change the quick reference for some entities and reuse it when a new entity is created.
These types of entities have a unique identifier, called ENTITYGUID, that can't be changed: 

Companies
Individuals
Partnerships
Corporates / Other Entities

You can use these ENTITYGUID values to identify the entities when working with the Entities Reports API.
PaginationAs responses often contain many items, you can enable pagination to improve response time, reduce network traffic, and make the data set in the response easier to handle. Use the pagesize and pagenumber parameters to configure pagination in the requests you send.



Parameter
Type
Description



pagesize
Integer
The number of records on a page. Possible value range is between 1 and 200.


pagenumber
Integer
The page number of the result set. Possible value range is between 1 and 2147483647.


Requesting the API to return only specific columnsYou can use the Get data with specific column POST requests to define what columns of the report you want the API to return. To learn what columns are available in the report in question, send a Get meta data request to the corresponding endpoint. The key field contains the column identifiers in the response.

Add the keys for the columns you want to get the data for to the Columns section of the Get data with specific column POST request. If you specify no columns in the request, the API returns the default columns in the response.
Column-Level FilteringWith column-level filtering, you can apply filters to POST requests so that the API returns only the required data from the report.
To apply column-level filtering, you need to set the following two parameters in the body of the request:

FilterCombinator: This parameter sets the logic for the filters. The possible values are AND and OR.
Filters: This parameter contains the filters. Each filter consists of a column key, an operator, and a value or values that are applied to the data before the response is returned.

If you set these parameters as they are in the example request below, the response will only contain results where the company name contains Diligent AND the individual’s name starts with Tim.

FilterCombinator
The FilterCombinator sets the logic for the filters in the Filters parameter and applies to all the defined filters.



FilterCombinator Value
Operator
Description



0
AND
All filter conditions must be met. This is the default value if no combinator is specified.


1
OR
Only one of the filter conditions must be met.


Filters
Use the Filters parameter to define the filter conditions. You can add multiple filters to a request. Filters contain the following elements:

Key
Operator
PrimaryValue
SecondaryValue

Whether the PrimaryValue and SecondaryValue elements are required depends on the operator type.

Key
The identifier of the column the filter applies to.
You can get a list of available column keys for each report by sending a request to the Get meta data endpoint. For example, to find out about the available keys for the companies report, send a request to the /reports/companies/meta endpoint.
Operator
The operator to be applied to the filter.
The available operators depend on the type of column being filtered. You can learn about the column types by sending a request to the Get meta data endpoint.



Column Type
Valid Operator Types



Text
contains, notcontains, startswith, endswith, equal, notequal, isnull, isnotnull


Date, Long & Double
greaterthan, greaterthanorequal, lessthan, lessthanorequal, between, isnull, isnotnull, equal, notequal


Bool
istrue, isfalse

Jet Delivery - API v1           BodyHeaders (7)BodyHeaders (7)BodyHeaders (7)  Public Documentation SettingsENVIRONMENTjetdelivery.com - ProductionLAYOUTDouble ColumnLANGUAGEcURL - cURLJet Delivery - API v1Introduction GETTrack shipmentsGETRates and transit timesPOSTSchedule shipmentsPOSTCancel shipmentsPOSTFile UploadGETFile Upload | DeleteGETGet documentsJet Delivery - API v1This is a Postman collection for the Jet Delivery API endpoints. The information provided here aims to explain how you can tie our core shipping, tracking, and rating services directly into your web applications and/or ERP systems.
This will give your business the ability to offer an integrated same-day shipping option to any destination within the United States. Please see the following documentation for more details: https://www.jetdelivery.com/developer/. In case you have an API related question, you can call us at 800-203-1633.
Installation
Go to the collection then just click Run in Postman.
Environment
This collection includes a pre-configured environment setting. You will be needing to set up below variables in order to run each request:



Name
Description




key
Your Api key



The API key you use to authenticate the request determines whether the request is live mode or test mode.
GETTrack shipmentshttps://www.jetdelivery.com/api/v1/utilities/track/?id=2345678&ref=&key=key_test_2rWvqrGtfgb51yuiR428ektYou can use our tracking endpoint to get the real-time status of your shipment. The results include the GPS location of the driver (when available), reference, signature, event history, and more.
No api-key is required to use this endpoint. In it's simplest form, an API call may look like: https://www.jetdelivery.com/api/v1/utilities/track/?idx=2345678
For security reasons, unless you provide an api-key we will display only the weighted center of each zip-code rather than the exact origin and destination locations.
PARAMSid2345678Required. This can be the 6-8 digit tracking number assigned to your shipment at the time of booking, or it can be the unique billing reference provided to us. Up to 23 characters.
refOptional. Sending "link-ref" attempts to match the "id" to a billing reference in our system rather than our tracking number.
keykey_test_2rWvqrGtfgb51yuiR428ektOptional. This is your unique API key, linked to a specific Jet Delivery account.

Depending on the zip-codes you enter, different services may or may not be available. 
No api-key is required to use this endpoint. However, if you don't send an api-key in your request, you will not get any special pricing that applies to your specific account. 
In it's simplest form, an API call may look like: https://www.jetdelivery.com/api/v1/utilities/quote/?origin=90021&destination=91750
PARAMSorigin90021Required. This should be the 5-digit zip code the shipment is originating from.
destination91750Required. This should be the 5-digit zip code the shipment is delivering to.
pieces1Optional. Total number of pieces. 
weight1Optional. Total weight of shipment.
pickup_req_dateOptional. Date shipment will be ready for pickup. Use  MM/DD/YYYY format. If left blank, the date will default to the current day. Note Weekends and holidays may have an impact on the pricing returned.
pickup_req_timeOptional. Time shipment will be ready for pickup. Use  24-hour format HH:MM. If left blank the time will default to the current time. 
deliver_req_dateOptional. Date shipment must be delivered on. Use MM/DD/YYYY format. If left blank, the date will default to ASAP.
deliver_req_timeOptional. Time shipment should be delivered by. Use  24-hour format HH:MM. If left blank the time will default to ASAP. 
keykey_test_2rWvqrGtfgb51yuiR428ektOptional. This is your unique API key, linked to a specific Jet Delivery account.

API








Our APIs are a fast, easy way to integrate our shipping functionality into your business applications and websites, allowing you to bypass the traditional HTML forms process and make shipping more convenient.

REST APIs
Through REST, Estes offers pickup request, pickup visibility, shipment tracking, and invoice APIs. 





API Portal
Visit our portal to see the codes, definitions, and capabilities of our newest REST APIs.






Getting Started
Contact one of our API experts to begin integrating our APIs into your systems:

Call (804) 353-1900, Ext. 2600 and press 3
Email WebSupport@estes-express.com

Legacy/SOAP APIs
Through SOAP, Estes offers rate quote, bill of lading, pickup request, shipment tracking, image retrieval, and transit time APIs. 





Rate Quote Web Service
Estes provides a web service for requesting rate quotes.








Bill of Lading Web Service
Create BOLs using our web service.








Pickup Request Web Service
Estes provides a web service for requesting pickups.








Shipment Tracking Web Service
Estes provides a web service for tracking your shipments.








Image Retrieval Web Service
Estes provides a web service for retrieving shipping images (delivery receipts, BOLs, etc.)








Transit Time Web Service
Estes provides a web service for calculating transit times between two points.

Frequently Asked Questions










Frequently Asked Questions








Below you will find a comprehensive list of frequently asked questions about Carey services, The Carey Mobile App, and other popular topics. The order that the questions appear within each category is determined by the frequency of the question asked. If you do not see the answer to you particular question in the first 5-10 entries, then you should use the search function at the top of this page to locate your specific question. If you are still unable to locate an answer to your question after searching, please access the directory tab and contact the appropriate Carey department.
 
Technology  Managed Accounts  Technology Partners  Large Groups  Travel Partners  Service Issues





Technology
 



Q: What tools does Carey offer for online booking and reservation management?
A: Carey offers traveler-centric booking tools on www.carey.com as well as mobile apps available in the Apple and Google Play app stores. For Travel Professionals booking and managing travel for themselves or others we offer Carey Connect; our free web based travel management tool.

Q: I book for myself on Carey.com and the Carey mobile app; how do I begin booking for others?
A: Booking for others is simple and easy by using CareyConnect (c) in place of Carey.com. All of your profile information will immediately be available to you on www.careyconnect.com and no additional registration is required. Simply log in with your existing credentials and you are ready to go!

Q: Can Carey Connect be used on a mobile device?
A: Carey Connect was not designed to be used on a mobile device. While it may function, the user experience will be less than ideal. We highly recommend using Carey Connect on a laptop or desktop or mobile device with an integrated keyboard.

Q: Can I customize the notifications I receive when traveling with Carey?
A: Yes. All travelers may customize their notification preferences via www.carey.com or by downloading the Carey mobile app. Users may opt out of email, SMS, update the preferred email address for notifications, change login IDs or add additional recipients to be copied on email notifications.

Q: What is the best way to obtain a copy of a credit card receipt without having to call?
A: Credit Card receipts are available online on www.CareyConnect.com both from the home page and upon logging into the application. For travelers, receipts are available through the mobile app and on Carey.com. It can take between up to 24 hours for receipts to be available but most process within a few hours of the trip completing.

Q: Why isn't my credit card receipt available immediately?
A: At the completion of each trip, chauffeurs must enter tolls, parking, unplanned wait time or other incidentals. This can cause a slight delay in the final close out of each trip.

Q: Why can't someone reset my password over the phone?
A: Security and privacy are of the utmost importance at Carey. If you have forgotten your password, self-service password reset is available on all of our digital channels. This requires you have access to the email address used to update your profile. If you no longer have access (for example due to a change of employment) you will be required to create a new user account with us.

Q: Is Carey PCI Compliant?
A: Yes. Carey International, Inc. is PCI compliant and conducts routine scans of all systems to ensure compliance remains in effect at all times.

Q: What does Carey do with my personal data?
A: Carey International uses personal data such as name, email address and/or mobile number for the sole purpose of communicating with our travelers and their associated arrangers and delivering service.





Back to Top





Managed Accounts
 



Q: Does Carey offer discounts on its services for corporate customers?
A: Carey offers volume based discounts for buyers who meet minimum volume thresholds. To speak with a member of our sales team contact account.services@carey.com.

Q: I manage travel for our entire organization.  How can I view and manage all of my Carey spend in one place?
A: Carey can issue all of your travelers a corporate ID. This ID will be used with all reservations, is visible through all of our technology and is used for Travel Management professionals to gain insight into your entire program. To request a corporate ID contact account.services@carey.com.

Q: How do I manage my organization's ability to grant or restrict access to our corporate account?
A: Our account services team can assist with linking your traveler’s profiles to your corporate account or removing an employee who is no longer employed. The best way to manage access is via www.careyconnect.com where your Primary Travel Manager can view all profiles linked to the corporate account, add new ones or revoke access as needed.





Back to Top





Technology Partners
 



Q: What third party booking tools is Carey available to be booked on?
A: Carey is available for booking on the following technology partners and their supported travel tools: Deem, Deem Travel, Etta, Groundspan, Sabre, Apollo, Travelport, Amadaeus, Mozio and Gett

Q: How do I submit a request for Carey to be added to a new technology partner's booking tool?
A: You can email us at digitalsupport@carey.com to submit a request for connectivity to a new tool.

Q: Does Carey have online resources for 3rd party developers?
A: Yes! API information, documentation and a sandbox enviornment is provided for developers to test and integrate with Carey’s open API.

Q: What services are available through the Carey API?
A: The Carey API extends the full Carey experience through its API stack. This includes shop (get quote), book, modify, cancel, trip status, chauffeur details and GPS location services.





Back to Top





Large Groups
 



Q: Does Carey have large capacity vehicles in its fleet?
A: Carey offers a full array of large capacity vehicles in its fleet. Visit carey.com/the-carey-standard/our-fleet/ to learn more about the extensive vehicle offerings in the Carey fleet.

Q: Can I book services for a large meeting or multi-vehicle event online?
A: Currently, many of our largest capacity vehicles are booked by submitting a request for proposal to events@carey.com or visit carey.com/travel-management-services/meetings-events/ for more information.

Q: Can I manage the reservations for my meeting, event or large group movement online?
A: Yes! All reservations booking as part of your group will be available on Carey Connect for full visibility, tracking and management.

Q: Will the attendees of my event be able to use the Carey Mobile app?
A: This depends on the requirements of your event, the location and vehicle requirements. Contact a Carey Coordinator at events@carey.com to discuss the specific logistics requirements for your event.





Back to Top





Travel Partners
 



Q: Does Carey offer Travel Partner commissions?
A: Carey offers its Travel Partners commissions on each booking with exlusions on corporate bookings with existing disounts or reduced rate pricing.

Q: What travel industry organizations does Carey extend its commission programs to?
A: Carey participates with ARC, IATA, CLIA and TRUE travel advisors and their associated agencies.

Q: What if I need to make a booking but don't have a valid ARC or IATA number yet or Carey's system doesn't recognize the ID provided?
A: A valid ARC or IATA number is required at the time of booking in order for commissions to process. Carey obtains valid ARC, IATA, CLIA and TRUE IDs from each organization on a monthly basis. There can often times be a delay in these updates occurring.





Back to Top





Service Issues
 



Q: How do I notify Carey of a service issue?
A: To notify Carey of a service issue or to share positive feedback on your service experience please email customer.service@carey.com. Please include the reservation number(s) and provide your preference for follow-up contact method (phone or email). One of our Customer Care Specialists will investigate the issue and respond accordingly.
